name: SH900 Extend Table
description:
Description

Copenhagen Design studio Strand + Hvass nods to previous Danish design icons while also exploring a new generation's sensibility in Extend. The dining table lives up to its name, with built-in leaves and a unique fold-out system hidden inside; simply pull on the table end to reveal seating for 4 extra guests. With its solid oak top and frame available in a variety of finishes, the black MDF extension leaves feature a honeycomb interior construction that makes them at once durable and lightweight.

Specifications

Size

  • 28.3" h x 118.1" w x 39.4" d (72x300x100cm)
  • Extendable: 39.4" l x 43.3" w (100x110cm)
  • Distance between legs: 33.1" w (84cm)

Material

Oak
meta_title: SH900 Extend Table | Buy Carl Hansen & Søn online at A+R

name: TA001P Dream Chair
description:
Description

As a tribute to Danish modernist Hans J. Wegner, Japanese architect Tadao Ando conceived Dream Chair, a uniquely comfortable piece of furniture that invites relaxed reflection. But to achieve the sculptural contours, Ando and the cabinetmakers at Carl Hansen & Søn pushed the size and curvature of the 3-D veneer sheet to the limit—and beyond what was thought possible. Striking from every angle, the walnut structure complements foam-fill front upholstery and an adjustable neck cushion in rich leather.

Specifications

Size

  • 39.4" h x 31.5" w x 33.9" d (100x80x86cm)
  • Seat height: 14.2" (36cm)

Material

Walnut, foam

  • Leather Group C: Sif
  • COM and COL are available on request

name: MG501 Outdoor Cuba Chair: Cotton Webbing
description:
Description

With its natural materials, clean cotton webbing and evident craftsmanship, MG501 Cuba Chair beautifully embodies the concept of complex simplicity. Designer Morten Gøttler’s elseating features a solid oak frame, with the cotton lengths around the frame forming a comfortable seat and back and providing excellent support as they gently follow the body’s contours. Elegant but nonchalant, this folding lounge chair is ideal as either extra or permanent seating and can easily be hung on a wall or placed on a floor stand for convenient storage.

Specifications

Size

  • 29.9" h x 24" w x 31.1" d (76x61x79cm)
  • Seat height: 15.4" (39cm)

Material

Cotton webbing
meta_title: MG501 Outdoor Cuba Chair: Cotton Webbing | Buy Carl Hansen & Søn online at A+R

name: MG501 Outdoor Cuba Chair: Paper Cord
description:
Description

Designed in 1997, Morten Gøttler's elegant folding Cuba Chair now gets a variation with the seat and back in paper cord, for an even lighter and more refined expression. Featuring a solid-oak frame, the chair’s characteristic gentle curves provide excellent support as they gently follow the body’s contours. With fine craftsmanship and close attention to detail, the foldable lounge chair serves as either permanent or impromptu seating, and it can easily be hung on a wall or placed on a floor stand when not in use.

Specifications

Size

name: PK52A Student Desk
description:
Description

Student Desk serves as a smaller version of Poul Kjærholm's series created in 1955 when he was a lecturer at the Danish Academy of Fine Arts. The modernist established his design bonafides via the versatile design with its frame in black or grey lacquered steel and tabletop in oak veneer or reversible gray and black laminate. A timeless style that showcases both his signature steel and wood construction and unerring craftsmanship, PK52A also offers an optional drawer module.

Specifications

Size

28.3" h x 55.7" w x 33.5" d (72x141.5x85cm)

Material

Powder-coated steel

name: ML10097 Egyptian Table
description:
Description

Legendary Dane Mogens Lassen looked to ancient sources of inspiration for his Egyptian Table, suggested by folding stands found in Tutankhamun's tomb. In turn, his design easily collapses for storage with the release of a small brass sliding latch beneath the tabletop—a functionality also borrowed from furniture archetypes like knockdown safari chairs. Crafted in solid oak or walnut with veneer in a range of varied finishes, the round table also comes in a choice of 2 sizes.

Specifications

Size

  • Small: 20.5" h x 33.5" dia (52x85cm)

Oak or walnut

name: Pallet Daybed
description:
Description

Designer Sebastian Herkner reconsiders the daybed with Pallet, nodding to its utilitarian origins with a plain frame constructed in natural or black-stained oak that leaves the woven-jute supporting straps visible. He then takes a further Punk turn with upholstery—in black or terracotta leather, velvet in dark grey or a shade he calls dirty pink—for the soft mattress fixed to the base with a cuff made of the same material.

Specifications

  • Frame: 11.4" h x 31.5" w x 78.7" d (29x80x200cm)

name: Type 75 Mini Table Lamp
description:
Description

Simplified in scope, with greater articulation and range of movement with the shade, this Type 75 Mini takes the original Anglepoise standard in a new direction. Sir Kenneth Grange's compact take on a table lamp for the timeless British brand is an ideal choice when a smaller, neater profile is preferred. With an aluminum shade and cover for its stable cast-iron base, it comes in 3 matte colors with brushed aluminum trim and features a large on-off button that’s ergonomically designed for ease of use.

name: Cloverleaf Sofa with Charging Station
description:
Description

One of legendary designer Verner Panton's indelible hallmarks, his 1969 Cloverleaf debuted at a fantasy roomscape he created for the legendary Visiona 2 exhibit on a ship adjoining the Cologne furniture fair. The modular sofa consists of right, left, middle and extended sections to create its curved angular form and sinuous backrest with niches that face alternately inwards and outwards. Available in variations spanning 2 to 6 individual units, it's constructed with an FSC-certified wood frame and molded cold foam for the comfortably contoured seat and back.

Specifications

Size

  • Left/Right unit: 31.5" h x 45.3" w x 45.1" d (80x115.5x114.5cm)
  • Middle unit: 31.5" h x 62.2" w x 55.9" d (80x158x142cm)

Carl Hansen & Søn adds to its Embrace collection with a pair of striking lounge tables—an expansive low coffee table and a slightly taller and slimmer side table. Straight from the "Mad Men" decade, the table lamp 1953 exhibits a refined Milanese take on Midcentury modernism from revered design luminaries Ostuni & Forti. name: Coupé Table Lamp
description:
Description

A covetable table lamp with a storied heritage, this variation from Joe Columbo's 1967 Coupé series remains as striking as it is useful. A simple, ingenious mechanism connects the chromed stem to the gloss lacquered aluminum shade (matching the metal base) and the light beam can be aimed in any direction by simply moving the dome up, down as well as tilting it sideways. Oluce's enduring design is also part of the permanent collection at MoMA in New York and Munich's Neue Sammlung Museum.

name: Spider Table Lamp
description:
Description

Spider's high-tech impression was ahead of its time at its 1965 unveiling by Italian designer Joe Colombo. The table lamp's unique look comes from a box-like lacquered aluminum reflector ingeniously configured for a special horizontal spot lightbulb. Mounted on a chromium-plated stem, the adjustable light tilts as needed. Spider is part of the permanent collection of the Milan Triennale and was also featured in the memorable 1972 exhibit, “Italy: The New Domestic Landscape” at MoMA in New York.

name: Mini Coupé Table Lamp
description:
Description

A small wonder indeed, Mini Coupé extends the 1967 lighting series originated by Joe Colombo, with its timeless look and easily adjustable functionality. Oluce's diminutive version sports the same chrome stem and lacquered base and semi-cylindrical shade that moves up and down and also tilts left and right — aiming the light just where it is needed. A witty recap of the designer's '60s milieu, Mini comes in a new range of gloss hues to join its New York's MoMA Museum-classic big brother.

With a provocative contrast of black and gold finishes, Oluce adds a floor lamp to its Midcentury series 1953. With eloquent Milanese modernist style, as defined by the brand’s founder Giuseppe Ostuni in collaboration with Renato Forti, it’s a timeless piece with a handsome black cylindrical metal shade and a satin-gold reflector, supported by an offset pole stand with a black handle. Transcending time and trends with enduring geometry and a luxurious finish, Oluce’s 1953 collection includes a companion table lamp (also at A+R).

description:
Description

With a dramatic rotating arc, Joe Colombo's timeless 1967 series Coupé offers an adjustable wall version. Providing both direct and reflected illumination, the lamp can be aimed in any desired direction by moving the lacquered aluminum shade up or down on the chromed stem as well as pointing it sideways. Available in a choice of either a semi-cylindrical or a semi-spherical dome, Oluce's enduring design resides in the permanent collection at New York's MoMA in New York and Munich's Neue Sammlung.

name: Canopy Suspension Lamp
description:
Description

Canopy takes both its look and its name from the ceiling plate commonly used to conceal a light’s wiring. Designer Francesco Rota expands on the idea by exaggerating the dome shape, making the large-sized metal lampshade his striking focal point, in a choice of milky white or matte bronze. Reflecting off the whitened inside surface, a ring-shaped LED diffuses a soft, sinuous illumination into the surrounding environs.

name: Lyndon Suspension Lamp
description:
Description

Recalling street lamps in European capitals at the end of the 19th century, Lyndon's spherical motif adapts as a striking suspension lamp. Initiated by Vico Magistretti in 1977, this variation features a candelabra-style body with either a chromed-plate or satin-gold finish. Topped with 4 of the signature transparent glass spheres, each enclosing a diminutive light bulb, the designer puts a modern spin on the romantic elegance of the past.

name: Niwa Suspension Lamp
description:
Description

Tapping into the romantic notion of ancient sailing vessels, designer Christophe Pillet recasts the on-board lantern as a sleek suspension light glossed with lacquer and featuring a clear mouth-blown glass diffuser. For a range of indoor environs, Niwa provides a radiant glow from its LED light source protected by the glass bell of the cone-topped fixture. It's a timeless update from Italian maker Oluce, adding to a storied legacy of exceptional lighting design dating back to 1945.

name: Niwa Suspension Lamp: Outdoor
description:
Description

Designer Christophe Pillet adds an outdoor version of Niwa, his suspension light suggested by ancient ship's lamps and interpreted with a cleaner-cut shape, blown-glass diffuser and sophisticated lacquer finish. Within, the LED lightbulb is protected by the glass bell and both are fixed to a metal cone, attached to a free line cable that reveals the lighting's nomadic nature. Whether coiled around a tree branch or resting free nestled in the grass, Niwa is as versatile as it is stylish.

name: Fresnel Wall/Ceiling Lamp
description:
Description

Offering both direct and diffused illumination, designer Joe Colombo’s 1966 wall/ceiling Fresnel is named for its sleek light-refracting lens diffuser. The lamp’s pristine metal body — available in the white, black, grey or chrome-plated —discreetly completes the structure, prioritizing function above any unnecessary ornament. Founded in 1945, Oluce is the oldest Italian lighting design company still in operation today, continuing to provide products that communicate across generations.

name: Atollo Table Lamp: Metal
description:
Description

In Oluce’s gleaming metal version, light reflects off Atollo’s domed shade and then sweeps down its arching sides for a wam ambient glow that also defines the table lamp’s geometric inspiration. Composed of cylinder, cone and hemisphere shapes, Vico Magistretti’s 1977 design transcends ephemeral trends for an essential utility grounded in classical forms. Atollo is available in 3 different sizes and in a range of superb finishes from white and black to metallic choices in satin bronze or satin gold.

name: Atollo Table Lamp: Glass
description:
Description

From the vantage of today, Atollo has seems like the very archetype of the table lamp. Designed in 1977 by Vico Magistretti, its primary geometric shapes — a cylinder, cone and hemisphere — serve both its essential function and its basic aesthetic, disconnected from trends of the moment. The emphasis, then, is on its materiality, as in this version made of exquisite mouth-blown opaline Murano glass and available in 3 sizes, providing both direct and diffused light.
